introduction.para: This document outlines the procedure for replacing a bike fork. It details the necessary steps, precautions, and references to relevant documentation.

list.item: Standard Bike Tools (Wrenches, Allen Keys, etc.)
Reference Documentation (as indicated throughout the procedure)

preliminaryRequirements.para: Ensure the bike is securely positioned on a repair stand or stable surface.
Disconnect any electrical components if applicable.

task.para: Remove Front Wheel: Refer to documentation S1000BIKE-DA0-3-0-00-00-AA-520 for instructions on front wheel removal.
Remove Front Brakes: Refer to documentation S1000BIKE-DA1-2-0-00-00-AA-520 for instructions on front brake removal.
Remove Fork: Refer to documentation S1000BIKE-D00-0-0-01-00-AA-520 for instructions on fork removal.
Change Bike Axis: Refer to documentation S1000BIKE-D00-0-0-01-00-AA-93A for instructions on changing the bike axis.
Install New Fork: Options depend on the specific fork model.
Install Front Brakes: Refer to documentation S1000BIKE-DA1-2-0-00-00-AA-720 for instructions on front brake installation.
Install Front Wheel: Refer to documentation S1000BIKE-DA0-3-0-00-00-AA-720 for instructions on front wheel installation.
Fork Installation Test: Refer to documentation S1000BIKE-D00-0-0-01-00-AA-341 to verify proper fork installation.
Front Brakes Test: Refer to documentation BRAKE-DA1-0-0-00-00-AA-341 to verify proper brake function.

closingRemarks.para: This procedure provides a general guideline for bike fork replacement. Always consult the manufacturer's specifications and safety guidelines for your specific bike and components. Ensure all connections are secure before operating the bike.
